text:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.
It was a very harmonious meeting, without one.............note

In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.
The man was accused of premeditated murder but he pleaded that it was...............

In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.
We nearly lost the trend of his argument because of its complexity but the..............of his language was our saving grace
explanation: The underlined word in the sentence is "complexity," which refers to the state of being intricate, complicated, or difficult to understand. The sentence indicates that the complexity of the argument made it challenging to follow. The opposite of complexity is "simplicity." Option A, "simplicity," because it suggests that the straightforward and easy-to-understand nature of the language used in the argument was what made it easier for the audience to comprehend.

text:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.
Uche achieved ultimate success after overcoming many..........difficulties
explanation: The word "ultimate" implies the highest or final level of success. To find the opposite of "difficulties" in this context, we need to look for a word that suggests the beginning or start. "Initial" is the best choice because it implies the beginning or start of something.

text:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
I enjoy..............my grandson to school everday.

From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

It seems that the children are not paying attention,.............?
explanation:
Question tags turn a statement into a question. They are often used for checking information that we think we know is true. Usually if the main clause is positive, the question tag is negative, and if the main clause is negative, the question tag is positive. For example: It's cold (positive), isn't it (negative)?
From the sentence, ''It seems that the children are not paying attention, (Negative) are they (positive)? Option A is the correct answer

In question numbered 75 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: In this sentence, the term that fits logically in the blank is something that refers to the manifestations or indicators of malaria. When people have malaria, they experience certain observable features that we commonly refer to as "symptoms." Symptoms are the outward signs or indications of a disease.
